publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1274 Tommy Sheridan: Independent Police Complaints Tribunal—That the Parliament agrees, in the light of the comments made by Tom Wood, Deputy Chief Constable of Lothian and Borders Police in The Herald newspaper on 24 October 2000, that the case for an independent Police Complaints Tribunal is now overwhelming and that such a body should be established as a matter of urgency.
S1M-1274 Independent Police Complaints Tribunal (lodged on 24 October 2000) Shona Robison*, Alex Neil*

S1M-1274 Tommy Sheridan: Independent Police Complaints Tribunal—That the Parliament agrees, in the light of the comments made by Tom Wood, Deputy Chief Constable of Lothian and Borders Police in The Herald newspaper on 24 October 2000, that the case for an independent Police Complaints Tribunal is now overwhelming and that such a body should be established as a matter of urgency. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alex Neil
S1M-1274 Independent Police Complaints Tribunal (lodged on 24 October 2000) Christine Grahame*
S1M-1274 Independent Police Complaints Tribunal (lodged on 24 October 2000) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1274 Independent Police Complaints Tribunal (lodged on 24 October 2000) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1274 Tommy Sheridan: Independent Police Complaints Tribunal—That the Parliament agrees, in the light of the comments made by Tom Wood, Deputy Chief Constable of Lothian and Borders Police in The Herald newspaper on 24 October 2000, that the case for an independent Police Complaints Tribunal is now overwhelming and that such a body should be established as a matter of urgency. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1274 Independent Police Complaints Tribunal (lodged on 24 October 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1274 Independent Police Complaints Tribunal (lodged on 24 October 2000) Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-1274 Tommy Sheridan: Independent Police Complaints Tribunal-That the Parliament agrees, in the light of the comments made by Tom Wood, Deputy Chief Constable of Lothian and Borders Police in The Herald newspaper on 24 October 2000, that the case for an independent Police Complaints Tribunal is now overwhelming and that such a body should be established as a matter of urgency. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson

S1M-1274 Tommy Sheridan: Independent Police Complaints Tribunal-That the Parliament agrees, in the light of the comments made by Tom Wood, Deputy Chief Constable of Lothian and Borders Police in The Herald newspaper on 24 October 2000, that the case for an independent Police Complaints Tribunal is now overwhelming and that such a body should be established as a matter of urgency. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson

S1M-1274 Tommy Sheridan: Independent Police Complaints Tribunal—That the Parliament agrees, in the light of the comments made by Tom Wood, Deputy Chief Constable of Lothian and Borders Police in The Herald newspaper on 24 October 2000, that the case for an independent Police Complaints Tribunal is now overwhelming and that such a body should be established as a matter of urgency. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson

Supported by: Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson

S1M-1274 Tommy Sheridan: Independent Police Complaints Tribunal-That the Parliament agrees, in the light of the comments made by Tom Wood, Deputy Chief Constable of Lothian and Borders Police in The Herald newspaper on 24 October 2000, that the case for an independent Police Complaints Tribunal is now overwhelming and that such a body should be established as a matter of urgency.
